DataElement.preferredName: Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children IV Raw Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of items correctly answered, that has not been transformed, on the Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children Fourth Edition (WISC-IV).  Raw scores range from a maximum score of 0 to 136 depending on the area being assessed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children IV Test Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Outcomes from testing a person/subject using the Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children Edition 4 (WISC-IV), measuring a child's current cognitive abilities in  both verbal and nonverbal areas, including verbal comprehension, perceptual reasoning, working memory, and processing  speed.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Person Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children, Fourth Edition
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
Person; a human being.:An individually administered clinical instrument for assessing the cognitive ability of children aged
6 years through 16 years 11 months. It is a psychometric test that assesses a child's current cognitive abilities in
both verbal and nonverbal areas, including verbal comprehension, perceptual reasoning, working memory, and processing
speed.

Concepts.definition: An individually administered clinical instrument for assessing the cognitive ability of children aged 6 years through 16 years 11 months. It is a psychometric test that assesses a child's current cognitive abilities in both verbal and nonverbal areas, including verbal comprehension, perceptual reasoning, working memory, and processing speed. It was first published in 1949 and revised in 1974 (WISC-R). The third edition (WISC-III) was released in 1991 and the fourth edition (WISC-IV) in 2003.

Property.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children IV Raw Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Number of items correctly answered, that has not been transformed, on the Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children Fourth Edition (WISC-IV).  Raw scores range from a maximum score of 0 to 136 depending on the area being assessed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children, Fourth Edition Raw Score
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition:
An individually administered clinical instrument for assessing the cognitive ability of children aged
6 years through 16 years 11 months. It is a psychometric test that assesses a child's current cognitive abilities in
both verbal and nonverbal areas, including verbal comprehension, perceptual reasoning, working memory, and processing
speed.:Not processed or refined.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: An individually administered clinical instrument for assessing the cognitive ability of children aged 6 years through 16 years 11 months. It is a psychometric test that assesses a child's current cognitive abilities in both verbal and nonverbal areas, including verbal comprehension, perceptual reasoning, working memory, and processing speed. It was first published in 1949 and revised in 1974 (WISC-R). The third edition (WISC-III) was released in 1991 and the fourth edition (WISC-IV) in 2003.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support creation of neuropsychometric tool scoring formats within C3D for the CCR Neuropsychology Division.
